page.title: 19 Barham Resident Interview
page.content: Our school secretary's father came from Barham,so she has lived here all her life but not in the same house.She told us that there have been about 7 shops in the village at one time,selling different things including shoes.After the war,ration books were still used and once a week a man from the International delivered locally.The village primary school has seen several changes since its erection in 1858. Mobile classrooms and a hall have been added,and new toilets have been built.Dinners are no longer cooked at the school.Where most of the new housing estates are,there used to be fields,one of which was used by a visiting circus.The R.A.F were stationed at the nursing home during the Second World War,and a tanks corps were based at Broome Park.
